str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
When, at what time. From the base of pou and te; interrogative adverb, at what time.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To thirst for, desire earnestly. From a variation of dipsos; to thirst for.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Apparently a primary word; foreign; by implication, a guest or entertainer.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Rarely: stark-naked; generally: wearing only the under-garment; bare, open, manifest; mere. Of uncertain affinity; nude.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
